description.raw:
The pull request makes `<limit>` a required tag for `<axis2>`. This is currently the case for `<axis>` but not for `<axis2>`. This is counter-intuitive, but since the `<limit>` tag has defaults, making it required means the tag will be generated with default values if it's missing inside the parent tag.

As an example, before this PR, the following snippet would fail to load because a `<limit>` tag is missing in `<axis2>`.

```
...
<joint name="universal_demo" type="universal">
    <parent>universal_base</parent>
    <child>universal_shaft</child>   <axis>
      <xyz>0 0 1</xyz>
    </axis>
    <axis2>
      <xyz>1 0 0</xyz>
    </axis2>
</joint>
...
```

But it won't fail if I simply add an empty `<limit>` tag. Note that `<axis>` tag is still missing the `<limit>` tag. That's not a problem because `<limit>` is required under `<axis>`. 

```
...
<joint name="universal_demo" type="universal">
    <parent>universal_base</parent>
    <child>universal_shaft</child>
    <axis>
      <xyz>0 0 1</xyz>
    </axis>
    <axis2>
      <xyz>1 0 0</xyz>
      <limit></limit>
    </axis2>
</joint>
..

```
This pull request makes it so that the first example loads successfully.

title: [gz11] Make <limit> a required element for <axis2>
